title.narrative: 4.1: EVIDENCE, POLICY & BUDGET

description.narrative: National capacity is strengthened for evidence, policy and budget and institutional analyses, with a focus on reducing child poverty and disparity., which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Evaluation And Research, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection, Social Protection (Covid), Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Equity-sensitive national policies, programmes and budget allocations are made based on high quality evidence and strengthened oversight

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National capacity is strengthened for evidence, policy and budget and institutional analyses, with a focus on reducing childpoverty and disparity.

description.narrative: Statistics South Africa developed a multidimensional poverty tool for children with UNICEF support, and the actual analysis will be released in 2020. While lower than expected numbers for the three key social sector budgets have been tabled in Budget 2019, the recently-released Medium-Term Budget Policy Statement (MTBPS) 2019 indicated that basic education will achieve a 1.5 per cent inflation-adjusted growth rate in 2020, health (2.2%) and social protection (inclusive of social development) 1.5 per cent. Over the new Medium-Term Expenditure Framework (MTEF), only basic education is projected to sustain a below two per cent inflation-adjusted growth. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:03/02/2020
